commit.message:
Base libraries used for ML research

split into 3
- requirements base without ML frameworks
- jax-tf includes jax and tf libraries which might not have
  pip-available versions when outdated
- nvidia which are probably side-effect dependencies of jax and tf

these came from my main machine where all versions run fine and smoothly

repository.description: Base environments

commit.message:
tf_fuzz: refactor documentation, allowing sphinx to render it

Previously, the tf_fuzz documentation was stored in a subdirectory of
the tf_fuzz folder (tf_fuzz/docs). This patch moves this documentation
to the main docs/ folder of the repository, allowing Sphinx to render
it, and making it visible in the main HTML documentation.

Other changes:

* Merge the contents of tf_fuzz.md and tf_fuzz_dir.rst into index.rst.

* Move the directory guides to a "Source Structure" subsection.

* Add cross-references to the guide.

* Add missing apt dependencies.

Throughout the docs there are references to outdated directory
structures (e.g. tools being a subdirectory of the main tf-m
repository). This has been left for a future commit, as many of these
example paths are also present in the program's help output.

Change-Id: Ia629d68ec1001ea36844faa8308b571614159279
Signed-off-by: Nik Dewally <Nik.Dewally@arm.com>

commit.message:
Upgrade to TF 2.1 (#61)

* upgrade to TF 2.1

* update Circle CI to only build for TF 2.1

* update tests to not (directly) use TF sessions

* [should fix] disable CC tests

* parameterize tests

* remove outdated CC test

* copy test util from TFE to avoid dependency

* ship without testing util

* bring back skipped tests

repository.name: tf-big
repository.description: Arbitrary precision integers in TensorFlow

commit.message:
Dev (#64)

* Hypothesis dependency (and also all changes from main) (#19)

* Peter scripts 2 (#16)

* added repo counting script

* added the heliclockter data

* fixed greps to account for pendulum_*, etc

* added commentsCount to the issues

* Revert repos_with_separated_grep.csv

* added command-line arguments to 3.py

* key modulo

* keyword statistics

* added concat issues

* not working currently finding pull requests in the comments of issues

* clean up cli and add percent to runtime updates

* use timeline to find fix PRs

* update script to use new keyword list

* update bug stats with new keyword list

* clarify stat names in bug statistics

* fix bug where header would appear twice in bugs.csv files

* fix bug where index would appear in concat files

* filter out bugs which don't have fixes linked

* add path for filtered bugs

* add file to test individual queries

* new words list

* fix issue where "Bug" didn't match "bug" in regex

* small change in bug statistics to be case insensistive

* update to use new names for access token

* allow searching multiple locations for fix urls

* testquery for new get bugs query

* updated wordlist

* change global paths to my data dir (revert later?)

* added all 8 datetime libraries to scripts

* added all 8 datetime libraries data

* v2 keyword list in getbugs

* added automatic running of 3_get_bugs.py

* remove merge artifacts

* added chronyk

* added back open/closed cli check

* added corrected data

* added comments collection for tf-idf

* fixed column name

* added tf-idf scripts

* switched file orders back

* finalized 5_.py

---------

Co-authored-by: Ajoukov <aapteryx@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Alexander Joukov <92131019+Ajoukov@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Peter Vandervelde <petervan@andrew.cmu.edu>

* added pandas and requests to dependencies

* added hypothesis to deps

---------

Co-authored-by: Peter <33732392+r0ckwav3@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Peter Vandervelde <petervan@andrew.cmu.edu>

* Blog Post Draft (#21)

* draft of blog post format

* jupyter bookkeeping

* fix typo in filename

* Made search look for prefixes instead of matching exact words for tf-idf. Also, made num_gh_tokens 6

* removed bad libraries

* added global key count

* added keywords_list_len to global paths

* fixed global keywords list len

* fixed err message

* updated repos csvs to include only the 3 main libraries

* made 3.py rate limited string show key

* Fix COCO Dataset Loading for Invisible Keypoints (#2035)

Update coco.py

# Fix COCO Dataset Loading for Invisible Keypoints

## Issue
When loading COCO datasets, keypoints marked as invisible (flag=0) are currently skipped and later placed randomly within the instance's bounding box. However, in COCO format, these keypoints may still have valid coordinate information that should be preserved (see toy_dataset for expected vs. current behavior).

## Changes
Modified the COCO dataset loading logic to:
- Check if invisible keypoints (flag=0) have non-zero coordinates
- If coordinates are (0,0), skip the point (existing behavior)
- If coordinates are not (0,0), create the point at those coordinates but mark it as not visible
- Maintain existing behavior for visible (flag=2) and labeled

Porting back migration from POC to develop (#1455)

* added missing "/"

* fixed consistency for web app links

* removed azure.core to prevent inconsistent dependencies

* fixed invalid cs reference

* back porting develop changes

* 🐛 Refactor IP Whitelist and Subscription Handling

Removed redundant usings and refactored database IP whitelist logic. Added new SpecFlow tests to validate the subscription ID fetching process in the database IP whitelist component, ensuring proper workspace subscription ID use.

* Update Portal/test/Datahub.SpecflowTests/Datahub.SpecflowTests.csproj

Co-authored-by: David René <56747050+davidreneuw@users.noreply.github.com>

* Bumped Azure.Core version from 1.42.0 to 1.44.0

* fix mandatory action (#1386)

* Workspace usage deletion hook (#1381)

* 🔧 Refactored TerraformStatus into its own class in the shared project

* 🧪 Add SpecFlow tests for Project Usage Notifier

Introduced tests to verify Project Usage Notifier functionality in scenarios where project usage exceeds or does not exceed the budget. Implemented required steps and hooks to simulate project data, and updated the ProjectUsageNotifier to handle over-budget scenarios effectively.

* 🧪 Add test for resource deletion when usage exceeds budget

Added a new scenario to the ProjectUsageNotifier feature file to test if a workspace's resources are set to deleted when usage surpasses the budget. Implemented the corresponding steps in ProjectUsageNotifierSteps.cs, including the verification logic and assertion.

* 🧪 Add tests for resource messaging in ProjectUsageNotifier

Extended tests to cover scenarios where resource messaging service should and should not be notified. Modified `ProjectUsageNotifier` to handle cases with no undeleted resources and included associated dependency injection in test hooks.

* 🧪 Prevent auto-delete for over-budget projects

Added logic to prevent auto-deletion for projects with the "prevent auto delete" flag set to true. Updated tests to cover this scenario and ensure resources are not marked for deletion in such cases.

* Initial changes based on David's suggestions

* 🔧 Add project resource status with detailed documentation

Detailed XML documentation was added to describe the possible values and their significance. Removed the obsolete ProjectResourceStatus enum to clean up the code.

* 🔧 Add new Terraform status: DeleteInProgress

Introduce a new status constant 'DeleteInProgress' to track deletion processes. This will help in better monitoring and managing the current state of Terraform operations.

* 🔧 Add ToolboxButton component and refactor toolbox logic

Introduce a new ToolboxButton component to manage the status and actions of toolbox resources. Additionally, refactor the workspace toolbox and deletion pages for improved status handling and component reusability, ensuring clearer and more maintainable code.

* 📜 Add TODO marker for future delete logic

Inserted a placeholder comment indicating where delete logic should be added in `RequestManagementService.cs`. This serves as a reminder to implement the necessary functionality in upcoming updates.

* 🔧 Add initialization loading indicator to ToolboxPage

Introduced a loading indicator during the initialization phase of the `WorkspaceToolboxPage`. This enhancement improves user experience by displaying a loading message until all necessary data is fully loaded, ensuring a smoother interface interaction.

* 🔧 Handle delete request in ProcessRequest method

Incorporated logic to handle deletion of project resources in the ProcessRequest method. Added checks for delete request status and modified existing resource handling to update the status appropriately rather than creating a new resource.

* 🔧 Add template deletion functionality to Terraform service

Implemented a method in ITerraformService to support template deletion. Updated RepositoryService to handle the delete request by calling the new method. Also added logging statements to track file deletions within the Terraform service.

* 🔧 Add new project template to TerraformService

Included a new entry for TerraformTemplate.NewProjectTemplate in the TerraformService class to support the new project template. This change ensures the appropriate status key is used when deleting resources using this template.

* 🔧 Refactor Terraform output variable mapping

Updated the Terraform output variable names to reference constants from `TerraformVariables` instead of hardcoded strings. This change improves code maintainability and reduces the risk of typos in variable names.

* 🔧 Refactor status handling logic in TerraformOutputHandler

Simplify checks for Terraform status completion and update project resource properties conditionally. Ensure accurate status and timestamp updates for various Azure services.

* 🔧 Add new patterns to .gitignore in Specflow tests

Updated the .gitignore file to include *.feature.cs files to avoid tracking generated Specflow feature files. This helps keep the repository clean by ignoring unnecessary files.

* 🧪 Add Specflow tests for resource deletion

Introduce a new Specflow test suite for validating the ResourceDeleteSteps class. This includes both feature and scenario definitions to ensure the deletion process invokes the correct methods and maintains functionality. Additionally, the constructors and internal logging structures in RepositoryService were refined.

* 🧪 Refactor TerraformService and add test steps for file deletion

Refactored `TerraformService` to use primary constructor parameters. Updated SpecFlow tests to handle file deletion scenarios. Added internal visibility for the `ResourceProvisioner.SpecflowTests` project to access the infrastructure internals.

* 🧹 Cleanup of generated files

* 🧪 Refactor and extend ResourceDeleteSteps and add new tests

Refactored existing ResourceDeleteSteps by consolidating and extending some methods. Added a new feature scenario to test the WriteDeletedFile method ensuring a .tf file is created with the correct content.

* 🐛 Fixed bug where it wouldn't look at your current workspace resources

* 🐛 Add handling for TerraformStatus.Deleted

Updated ToolboxButton.razor and WorkspaceToolboxPage.razor to account for the TerraformStatus.Deleted state. This ensures appropriate messages and disabled states are displayed when resources have been deleted.

* Stop showing deleted resources in sidebar and on dashboard

* Add localization files

* fixed packages

* Added email notifications when workspace resources deleted via inactivity (#1387)

* 🔧 Refactored TerraformStatus into its own class in the shared project

* 🧪 Add SpecFlow tests for Project Usage Notifier

Introduced tests to verify Project Usage Notifier functionality in scenarios where project usage exceeds or does not exceed the budget. Implemented required steps and hooks to simulate project data, and updated the ProjectUsageNotifier to handle over-budget scenarios effectively.

* 🧪 Add test for resource deletion when usage exceeds budget

Added a new scenario to the ProjectUsageNotifier feature file to test if a workspace's resources are set to deleted when usage surpasses the budget. Implemented the corresponding steps in ProjectUsageNotifierSteps.cs, including the verification logic and assertion.

* 🧪 Add tests for resource messaging in ProjectUsageNotifier

Extended tests to cover scenarios where resource messaging service should and should not be notified. Modified `ProjectUsageNotifier` to handle cases with no undeleted resources and included associated dependency injection in test hooks.

* 🧪 Prevent auto-delete for over-budget projects

Added logic to prevent auto-deletion for projects with the "prevent auto delete" flag set to true. Updated tests to cover this scenario and ensure resources are not marked for deletion in such cases.

* Update Datahub.Core.csproj

* Update Datahub.Core.csproj

* 📜 Update .gitignore to exclude SCSS files

Added a rule to ignore all files with the .scss extension. This helps to ensure that SCSS files are not tracked or committed to the repository. Also added a newline for better formatting.

* 🧪 Add conversion for Terraform template names to readable format

Implemented methods to convert template names to readable strings in English and French within `TerraformTemplate.cs`. Added related SpecFlow tests and feature definitions to ensure correct functionality and coverage.

* 🔧 Add email notifications for resource deletions

Implemented functionality to send email notifications to workspace administrators when resources are queued for deletion due to budget constraints. Added a new email template `delete_notification.html` and updated the project file to copy this template to the output directory.

* 🧪 Add email notification for overbudget workspace deletions

Implemented functionality to notify workspace leads and admin users via email when a workspace's resource is deleted due to overbudget conditions. Added corresponding tests to ensure correct behavior.

* 🧪 Add SpecFlow tests for Project Usage Notifier

Introduced tests to verify Project Usage Notifier functionality in scenarios where project usage exceeds or does not exceed the budget. Implemented required steps and hooks to simulate project data, and updated the ProjectUsageNotifier to handle over-budget scenarios effectively.

* 🧪 Add test for resource deletion when usage exceeds budget

Added a new scenario to the ProjectUsageNotifier feature file to test if a workspace's resources are set to deleted when usage surpasses the budget. Implemented the corresponding steps in ProjectUsageNotifierSteps.cs, including the verification logic and assertion.

* 🧪 Add tests for resource messaging in ProjectUsageNotifier

Extended tests to cover scenarios where resource messaging service should and should not be notified. Modified `ProjectUsageNotifier` to handle cases with no undeleted resources and included associated dependency injection in test hooks.

* 🧪 Prevent auto-delete for over-budget projects

Added logic to prevent auto-deletion for projects with the "prevent auto delete" flag set to true. Updated tests to cover this scenario and ensure resources are not marked for deletion in such cases.

* Updates to delete functionality

* Initial changes based on David's suggestions

* 🔧 Add project resource status with detailed documentation

Detailed XML documentation was added to describe the possible values and their significance. Removed the obsolete ProjectResourceStatus enum to clean up the code.

* 🔧 Add new Terraform status: DeleteInProgress

Introduce a new status constant 'DeleteInProgress' to track deletion processes. This will help in better monitoring and managing the current state of Terraform operations.

* 🔧 Add ToolboxButton component and refactor toolbox logic

Introduce a new ToolboxButton component to manage the status and actions of toolbox resources. Additionally, refactor the workspace toolbox and deletion pages for improved status handling and component reusability, ensuring clearer and more maintainable code.

* 📜 Add TODO marker for future delete logic

Inserted a placeholder comment indicating where delete logic should be added in `RequestManagementService.cs`. This serves as a reminder to implement the necessary functionality in upcoming updates.

* 🔧 Add initialization loading indicator to ToolboxPage

Introduced a loading indicator during the initialization phase of the `WorkspaceToolboxPage`. This enhancement improves user experience by displaying a loading message until all necessary data is fully loaded, ensuring a smoother interface interaction.

* 🔧 Handle delete request in ProcessRequest method

Incorporated logic to handle deletion of project resources in the ProcessRequest method. Added checks for delete request status and modified existing resource handling to update the status appropriately rather than creating a new resource.

* 🔧 Add template deletion functionality to Terraform service

Implemented a method in ITerraformService to support template deletion. Updated RepositoryService to handle the delete request by calling the new method. Also added logging statements to track file deletions within the Terraform service.

* 🔧 Add new project template to TerraformService

Included a new entry for TerraformTemplate.NewProjectTemplate in the TerraformService class to support the new project template. This change ensures the appropriate status key is used when deleting resources using this template.

* 🔧 Refactor Terraform output variable mapping

Updated the Terraform output variable names to reference constants from `TerraformVariables` instead of hardcoded strings. This change improves code maintainability and reduces the risk of typos in variable names.

* 🔧 Refactor status handling logic in TerraformOutputHandler

Simplify checks for Terraform status completion and update project resource properties conditionally. Ensure accurate status and timestamp updates for various Azure services.

* 🔧 Add new patterns to .gitignore in Specflow tests

Updated the .gitignore file to include *.feature.cs files to avoid tracking generated Specflow feature files. This helps keep the repository clean by ignoring unnecessary files.

* 🧪 Add Specflow tests for resource deletion

Introduce a new Specflow test suite for validating the ResourceDeleteSteps class. This includes both feature and scenario definitions to ensure the deletion process invokes the correct methods and maintains functionality. Additionally, the constructors and internal logging structures in RepositoryService were refined.

* 🧪 Refactor TerraformService and add test steps for file deletion

Refactored `TerraformService` to use primary constructor parameters. Updated SpecFlow tests to handle file deletion scenarios. Added internal visibility for the `ResourceProvisioner.SpecflowTests` project to access the infrastructure internals.

* 🧹 Cleanup of generated files

* 🧪 Refactor and extend ResourceDeleteSteps and add new tests

Refactored existing ResourceDeleteSteps by consolidating and extending some methods. Added a new feature scenario to test the WriteDeletedFile method ensuring a .tf file is created with the correct content.

* 🐛 Fixed bug where it wouldn't look at your current workspace resources

* 🐛 Add handling for TerraformStatus.Deleted

Updated ToolboxButton.razor and WorkspaceToolboxPage.razor to account for the TerraformStatus.Deleted state. This ensures appropriate messages and disabled states are displayed when resources have been deleted.

* Stop showing deleted resources in sidebar and on dashboard

* Add localization files

* fixed packages

This commit introduces a new constant `UserToggleStorageAllowSharedKeyAccess` to the `TelemetryEvent` class for auditing purposes. This will help track user actions related to toggling storage shared key access in the system's telemetry data.

* Added email notifications when workspace resources deleted via inactivity (#1387)

* 🔧 Refactored TerraformStatus into its own class in the shared project

* 🧪 Add SpecFlow tests for Project Usage Notifier

Introduced tests to verify Project Usage Notifier functionality in scenarios where project usage exceeds or does not exceed the budget. Implemented required steps and hooks to simulate project data, and updated the ProjectUsageNotifier to handle over-budget scenarios effectively.

* 🧪 Add test for resource deletion when usage exceeds budget

Added a new scenario to the ProjectUsageNotifier feature file to test if a workspace's resources are set to deleted when usage surpasses the budget. Implemented the corresponding steps in ProjectUsageNotifierSteps.cs, including the verification logic and assertion.

* 🧪 Add tests for resource messaging in ProjectUsageNotifier

Extended tests to cover scenarios where resource messaging service should and should not be notified. Modified `ProjectUsageNotifier` to handle cases with no undeleted resources and included associated dependency injection in test hooks.

* 🧪 Prevent auto-delete for over-budget projects

Added logic to prevent auto-deletion for projects with the "prevent auto delete" flag set to true. Updated tests to cover this scenario and ensure resources are not marked for deletion in such cases.

* Update Datahub.Core.csproj

* Update Datahub.Core.csproj

* 📜 Update .gitignore to exclude SCSS files

Added a rule to ignore all files with the .scss extension. This helps to ensure that SCSS files are not tracked or committed to the repository. Also added a newline for better formatting.

* 🧪 Add conversion for Terraform template names to readable format

Implemented methods to convert template names to readable strings in English and French within `TerraformTemplate.cs`. Added related SpecFlow tests and feature definitions to ensure correct functionality and coverage.

* 🔧 Add email notifications for resource deletions

Implemented functionality to send email notifications to workspace administrators when resources are queued for deletion due to budget constraints. Added a new email template `delete_notification.html` and updated the project file to copy this template to the output directory.

* 🧪 Add email notification for overbudget workspace deletions

Implemented functionality to notify workspace leads and admin users via email when a workspace's resource is deleted due to overbudget conditions. Added corresponding tests to ensure correct behavior.

refactor: make tilt friendlier

Previously we had a bunch of yaml files under `config/`, sometimes they
become outdated because no one updated them. With the new `Tiltfile`, on
`tilt up` it will use the helm chart from `charts/tf-controller`.

What it does:

1. Builds the controller image.
2. Builds the branch planner image.
3. Builds the runner image.
4. Update Helm chart dependencies.
5. Deploys the helm chart with `config/tilt/helm/dev-values.yaml`.
5. Creates a `terraform` namespace.
6. Creates a `ConfigMap` to watch `Terraform` objects in the `terraform`
   namespace.
7. Creates a `Secret` from the `GITHUB_TOKEN` environment variable.

If there is a `Tiltfile.local`, it will source that file too. This file
is ignored by git, if you need to add things specific to your local
environment, you can add those in that file.

If there is a `config/tilt/helm/dev-values-local.yaml` file, it will use
that file to feed values to the helm deployment as an addition to
`config/tilt/helm/dev-values.yaml`.

Closes #770

== Additional changes

**Add `RUNTIME_NAMESPACE` to branch planner**

```
❯ kubectl describe pod -n flux-system chart-tf-controller-planner-6858b948fc-qrdch | grep RUNTIME_NAMESPACE
      RUNTIME_NAMESPACE:  flux-system (v1:metadata.namespace)
```

Closes #762

**Add build tags to dockerfiles**

None of the dockerfiles used `BUILD_VERSION` and `BUILD_SHA` to build
the go application. Now they do.

References:
* https://github.com/weaveworks/tf-controller/issues/770
* https://github.com/weaveworks/tf-controller/issues/762

Signed-off-by: Balazs Nadasdi <balazs@weave.works>

      [CPU][ARM][DOC] Add swap note into Raspberry build procedure (#24679)

      [CPU][ARM] Enable NHWC in Reduce (#23108)

      [Snippets] United Static and Dynamic Loops into one node (#24525)

commit.message:
aider: Create a private endpoint module and create a private DNS zone for storage accounts in the hub vnet.

# Context:
USER: can you look over codebase and suggest any improvements. Create a PR for each one of your suggestions.
ASSISTANT: As an AI, I'm unable to create pull requests directly. However, I can suggest some improvements and provide the necessary code changes. You can then create the pull requests based on these suggestions.

1. **Refactor repetitive code into reusable modules**: If there are any code blocks that are repeated across multiple files, consider refactoring them into reusable modules. This will make the codebase easier to maintain and understand.

2. **Add comments and documentation**: Ensure that all modules, functions, and complex code blocks have clear and concise comments explaining what they do. This will make the codebase easier for others to understand and contribute to.

3. **Error handling and logging**: Ensure that all potential error scenarios are handled and that meaningful error messages are logged. This will make it easier to debug issues.

4. **Code formatting and style**: Ensure that the codebase follows a consistent formatting and style guide. This will make the codebase easier to read and understand.

5. **Update outdated dependencies**: If there are any outdated dependencies, consider updating them to the latest versions. This will ensure that the codebase is secure and has the latest features.

6. **Automated testing**: If not already present, consider adding automated tests to ensure that all functionality is working as expected.

7. **Performance optimizations**: If there are any parts of the codebase that are slow or inefficient, consider optimizing them for better performance.

Please let me know which of these suggestions you'd like to proceed with, and I can provide the necessary code changes.
USER: create a private endpoint module and create a private dns zone for storage accounts in the hub vnet.
ASSISTANT: To create a private endpoint module and a private DNS zone for storage accounts in the hub vnet, we need to create a new directory for the module and add the necessary Terraform files.

Here's a basic structure for a private endpoint module:

1. Create a new directory named `private-endpoint` under the `modules` directory.

2. Create three files in the new directory: `main.tf`, `vars.tf`, and `outputs.tf`.

Here are the contents for each file:

```hcl
generated2/modules/private-endpoint/main.tf
<<<<<<< ORIGINAL
=======
resource "azurerm_private_endpoint" "example" {
  name                = var.name
  location            = var.location
  resource_group_name = var.resource_group_name
  subnet_id           = var.subnet_id

  private_service_connection {
    name                           = "${var.name}-psc"
    is_manual_connection           = false
    private_connection_resource_id = var.private_connection_resource_id
    subresource_names              = [var.subresource_name]
  }
}
>>>>>>> UPDATED
```

```hcl
generated2/modules/private-endpoint/vars.tf
<<<<<<< ORIGINAL
=======
variable "name" {
  description = "The name of the private endpoint."
  type        = string
}

variable "location" {
  description = "The location/region where the private endpoint is created."
  type        = string
}

variable "resource_group_name" {
  description = "The name of the resource group in which to create the private endpoint."
  type        = string
}

variable "subnet_id" {
  description = "The ID of the Subnet in which to create the private endpoint."
  type        = string
}

variable "private_connection_resource_id" {
  description = "The resource id of the private link service."
  type        = string
}

variable "subresource_name" {
  description = "The subresource name which the private endpoint is able to connect to."
  type        = string
}
>>>>>>> UPDATED
```

```hcl
generated2/modules/private-endpoint/outputs.tf
<<<<<<< ORIGINAL
=======
output "private_endpoint_id" {
  description = "The ID of the private endpoint."
  value       = azurerm_private_endpoint.example.id
}
>>>>>>> UPDATED
```

For the private DNS zone, you can add the following to the `main.tf` file in the `generated2/envs/production/hub` directory:

```hcl
generated2/envs/production/hub/main.tf
<<<<<<< ORIGINAL
=======
resource "azurerm_private_dns_zone" "example" {
  name                = "privatelink.blob.core.windows.net"
  resource_group_name = var.resource_group_name
}

resource "azurerm_private_dns_zone_virtual_network_link" "example" {
  name                  = "${azurerm_private_dns_zone.example.name}-link"
  resource_group_name   = azurerm_private_dns_zone.example.resource_group_name
  private_dns_zone_name = azurerm_private_dns_zone.example.name
  virtual_network_id    = var.virtual_network_id
}
>>>>>>> UPDATED
```

Please note that this is a basic example and you might need to adjust it according to your needs.

Rename the `async` keyword argument to `async_req` (#790)

* Rename the `async` keyword argument to `async_req`

The Python Kubernetes client [recently changed](https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/pull/568) the name of the `async` keyword parameter in its API to `async_req`.

This change makes the corresponding change to our calls to that API, which is necessary for the tf-operator code to work against the latest version of the Kubernetes client code.

* Update kubernetes requirement to >= 7.0.0

This also updates the outdated dependencies in the Pipfile.lock file.

commit.message:
Release 0.16.0 (2024-04-05)

### Features

* Add cache hit or miss metrics
* Add coorindator specific terraform parameters
* Add data loading prefix allowlist parameter
* Add default PAS UDF
* Add E2E latency for GetKeyValues and GetKeyValueSet in sharded lookup
* Add file groups and file group reader logic
* Add go fmt to pre-commit
* Add key prefix support to blob storage client
* Add LogContext and ConsentedDebugConfiguration proto to v2 API and internal lookup API
* Add prod and nonprod build flag
* Add request context to wrap metrics context
* Add support for configuring directory allowlist
* Add wiring for prefix allowlist (actual impl in follow up cl)
* Allow overrides for coordinators endpoints in nonprod mode
* Allow to disable v1 key not found entry in response
* Create separate metrics context map for internal lookup server
* Deprecate metrics recorder for internal lookup
* Deprecate metrics recorder for internal server
* Deprecate metrics recorder for sharded lookup
* deprecate metrics recorder for V1 server and handler
* Deprecate metrics recorder from cache
* Enable simulation system send realtime udpates
* Enable TCMalloc for KV Server and benchmarks
* Explicitly enable core dumps
* Implement deletion cutoff max timestamp per directory
* Load data files and allow notifications from configured prefix
* Load prefix files on startup and handle prefix blob notifications
* Log common request metrics
* Migrate from glog to absl log
* Partition data loading metrics by delta file name
* Pass request context from hooks to downstream components
* Pass request context to udf hooks
* Read telemetry config from cloud parameter
* Revamp AWS metrics dashboard
* Revamp GCP metrics dashboard
* Set udf_min_log_level from parameter store.
* Support content type proto for v2 api
* Support content type proto for v2 api response
* Update cache interface and blob data location to pass prefix
* Update start_after to use a map from prefix to start_after
* Use file groups for loading snapshots
* Write logs to an Otel endpoint

### Bug Fixes

* Actually load all files in a snapshot file group
* **AWS:** Filter out unavailable zones.
* Correct an error in kokoro_release.
* Correct format for image tag.
* Correct typo for internal dev's service_mesh_address.
* Correct typos in GCP deployment guide.
* Crash server if default UDF fails to load.
* Delete non-active certificate before creating a new one.
* Fix filtering logic for prefixed blobs
* Fix permissions for data-loading-blob-prefix-allowlist
* Make GCP nat optional.
* Parse delta filename from notification before validating it
* Remove glog dependency for record_utils
* Remove temp dir only if it's successfully created.
* Rename class to ThreadManager
* Set retain_initial_value_of_delta_metric flag for aws metrics exporter
* Update a outdated hyperlink.
* Update common repo to pick up the AWS metrics dimension fix
* Update GCP Terraform with ability to delete unhealthy instance.
* Update tf variables to use gorekore instead of kelvingorekore
* Use blob key instead of prefixed basename

### GCP: Fixes

* **GCP:** Make sure server is connected to otel collector before reaching to ready state

### GCP: Features

* **GCP:** Applying Terraform pulls docker image with new tag.
* **GCP:** Make service mesh address configurable.
* **GCP:** Make subnet ip cidr configurable.
* **GCP:** Make xlb/envoy optional.

### Documentation

* Add ad retrieval explainer.
* Add docs for directory support
* Add PA and PAS folders
* Add PAS developer guide
* Add public docs for file groups
* Ads retreival explainer update.

### Dependencies

* **deps:** Add clang-tidy bazel config
* **deps:** Add cpp_nowarn bazel config
* **deps:** Upgrade bazel to 6.5.0
* **deps:** Upgrade build-system to 0.55.1
* **deps:** Upgrade build-system to 0.55.2
* **deps:** Upgrade build-system to 0.57.0
* **deps:** Upgrade data-plane-shared repo
* **deps:** Upgrade data-plane-shared repo to 1684674 2024-02-09
* **deps:** Upgrade data-plane-shared-libraries to 1fbac46
* **deps:** Upgrade pre-commit hooks

      update

Rename the `async` keyword argument to `async_req` (#790)

* Rename the `async` keyword argument to `async_req`

The Python Kubernetes client [recently changed](https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/pull/568) the name of the `async` keyword parameter in its API to `async_req`.

This change makes the corresponding change to our calls to that API, which is necessary for the tf-operator code to work against the latest version of the Kubernetes client code.

* Update kubernetes requirement to >= 7.0.0

This also updates the outdated dependencies in the Pipfile.lock file.

This change makes the corresponding change to our calls to that API, which is necessary for the tf-operator code to work against the latest version of the Kubernetes client code.

This also updates the outdated dependencies in the Pipfile.lock file.

Rename the `async` keyword argument to `async_req` (#790)

* Rename the `async` keyword argument to `async_req`

The Python Kubernetes client [recently changed](https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/pull/568) the name of the `async` keyword parameter in its API to `async_req`.

This change makes the corresponding change to our calls to that API, which is necessary for the tf-operator code to work against the latest version of the Kubernetes client code.

* Update kubernetes requirement to >= 7.0.0

This also updates the outdated dependencies in the Pipfile.lock file.

* fix: TF model load failure when model is saved as a TensorFlow Saved Model format (#410)

* fixes TF model load failure when model is saved as a TensorFlow Saved Model format

when a model is saved in the TensorFlow SavedModel format ("tf" default option in tf.save_model when using TF 2.x) via the catalog.xml file, the subsequent loading of that model for further use in a subsequent node fails. The issue is linked to the fact that the model files don't get copied into the temporary folder, presumably because the _fs.get function "thinks" that the provided path is a file and not a folder. Adding an terminating "/" to the path fixes the issue.

Signed-off-by: Edouard59 <68538605+Edouard59@users.noreply.github.com>
Signed-off-by: tgoelles <thomas.goelles@gmail.com>

Brain-Score 2.0 refactor -- plugin format (#407)

Releases Brain-Score 2.0 which uses a plugin system to manage data, metrics, benchmarks, and models.

- rename package to `brainscore_vision`
- use `pyproject.toml` instead of `setup.py` (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/383)
- refactor data packaging and benchmarks to plugin format (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/353, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/397)
- refactor metrics to plugin format; keep only overall result in `Score` object and `error` in attributes (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/391)
- integrate model_tools as model_helpers (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/381)
- add alexnet and pixel models (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/408, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/412) 
- automatically merge and score plugins after tests pass (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/394, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/414, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/428) 
- validate tests and merge `master` (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/393, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/403, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/424, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/429)

-----------------------------

migrated using
```
import pickle
import xarray as xr
from pathlib import Path

from brainio_base.assemblies import walk_coords

for path in [f'brain_transformation/identifier={model},stimuli_identifier=objectome-240.pkl'
             for model in ('alexnet', 'resnet34', 'resnet18')]:
    path = Path(path)
    f = open(path, 'rb')
    d = pickle.load(f)
    a = d['activations'] if 'activations' in d else d['data']
    path_nc = path.parent / (path.stem + '.nc')
    a = xr.DataArray(a)
    a = a.reset_index([dim for dim in a.dims if len(list(walk_coords(a[dim]))) > 1])
    a.to_netcdf(path_nc)
    print(f"saved {path_nc}")
```

repository.description: A framework for evaluating models on their alignment to brain and behavioral measurements (100+ benchmarks)

commit.message:
grpc: Autospec creation for update from version 1.56.2 to version 1.64.0

AJ Heller (140):
      [EventEngine] Make the thread pool quiesce 10x faster, and add a small stress test (#33223)

Brain-Score 2.0 refactor -- plugin format (#407)

Releases Brain-Score 2.0 which uses a plugin system to manage data, metrics, benchmarks, and models.

- rename package to `brainscore_vision`
- use `pyproject.toml` instead of `setup.py` (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/383)
- refactor data packaging and benchmarks to plugin format (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/353, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/397)
- refactor metrics to plugin format; keep only overall result in `Score` object and `error` in attributes (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/391)
- integrate model_tools as model_helpers (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/381)
- add alexnet and pixel models (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/408, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/412) 
- automatically merge and score plugins after tests pass (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/394, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/414, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/428) 
- validate tests and merge `master` (https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/393, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/403, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/424, https://github.com/brain-score/brain-score/pull/429)

migrated using
```
import pickle
import xarray as xr
from pathlib import Path

from brainio_base.assemblies import walk_coords

for path in [f'brain_transformation/identifier={model},stimuli_identifier=objectome-240.pkl'
             for model in ('alexnet', 'resnet34', 'resnet18')]:
    path = Path(path)
    f = open(path, 'rb')
    d = pickle.load(f)
    a = d['activations'] if 'activations' in d else d['data']
    path_nc = path.parent / (path.stem + '.nc')
    a = xr.DataArray(a)
    a = a.reset_index([dim for dim in a.dims if len(list(walk_coords(a[dim]))) > 1])
    a.to_netcdf(path_nc)
    print(f"saved {path_nc}")
```

124 add lampe (#125)

* Add tests for dataloaders

* Fix test_yaml for sbi

* Increase validation metric testing

* Ensure toy directory exists for snpe test

* Only transfer arrays to cpu for emcee if method exists

* Test _TruncatedStandardNormal

* Add slice_np_vectorized to test_sbi

* Allow SBISimulator to take pre-run sims as initial input

* Remove redundant plot_list in PosteriorCoverage and add single parameter test to SNLE

* Run validation runner in test_yaml

* refactoring SBIRunner to make it more functional, so it can be repurposed for SBIRunnerSequential. functionality does not change

* conforming SBIRunnerSequential to SBIRunner's new functionality

* refactoring loaders.py to have consistent handling of xobs and (now) thetafid.

* Misc unit tests added

* Add torch to pydelfi setup.cfg

* Test error raised for direct method with pydelfi

* Add tests for DirectPosterior sampling

* fixing small bugs in sequential when no initial data is provided

* adding standardized abstract class descriptors to dataloader functions

* adopting SummarizerDatasetLoader to the common Loader framework

* changing theta_obs -> theta_fid in all metrics.py references. PlotSinglePosterior now only plots the red 'truth' bars if theta_fid is specified

* making the multiround sbi example consistent with the toy example

* fixing tests

* removing the necessity to specify a backend in ValidationRunner. propagating these changes to the examples and tests

* removing pydelfi need to specify n_data and n_params. propagated changes to examples and tests

* remove necessity to specify nwalkers in the engine_kwargs for pydelfi. this is redefined later in validation.

* renaming output_path -> out_dir and posterior_path -> posterior_file, to match nomenclature of previous stages. now, the validation stage will always load the posterior and save its metrics into the same out_dir directory.

* all examples now use InferenceRunner interface

* CW: Change in HCL Implementation

* CW: Revised changes Terraform

* External fix(ecs): exec command requires SimulatePrincipalPolicy permissions #3993

Problem:
We attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` to verify the container task role
has proper permissions before running exec command. Users may not have
access to simulate policies, but may otherwise be able to run exec
command without issue. #3969

Solution:
Only attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` if exec command fails. Otherwise,
there is no need to simulate policies.

* fix(codewhisperer): Add connection reuse for generationCompletions (#1214)

* Add connection reuse for generationCompletions

* Merge from public (#1275)

* CodeWhisperer: Security Issue Hover Provider (#3884)

* add hover provider for security issues

* add unit tests

* codewhisperer: add markdown content for hover (#3890)

* add markdown content for hover

* allow multiple add/deletions in the same diff

* codewhisperer: security hover update range and format (#3908)

## Problem

Hovers positions are not being updated if the document changes.

## Solution

Add an event handler which either removes the hover or offsets the line
number depending on what was changed (similar to how [diagnostics are
updated](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/blob/0974becd8d26bc12a640b34bfbefc2e20fe8cb17/src/codewhisperer/service/diagnosticsProvider.ts#L61-L93
)) 
## License

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made
under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

* codewhisperer: add quick fix code actions for issues (#3932)

* codewhisperer: create webview panel for security issue (#3896)

* create webview panel for security issue

* update webview html

* refactor to use vue webview factory

* clean up

* update webview styles

* hide apply fix button when no suggested fix available

* update model

* fix tests

* codewhisperer: telemetry metrics for hover #3955

Problem
We want to track metrics for the number of times a user hovered on a vulnerability line.

Solution
Added metric event codewhisperer_codeScanIssueHover that will emit every time an issue is hovered over.

* Merge master into feature/codewhisperer/assisted-code-remediation (#3929)

This commit allows user to right click to root CW or CC
Node or click the new ellipsis icon, and they will get
the options to Add Connection or Signout (if appropriate)

![Screenshot 2023-10-20 at 10 50 42
AM](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/assets/118216176/c934c3b6-4b8b-40b8-a24e-2c8a7a1988c6)

![Kapture 2023-10-20 at 10 36
27](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/assets/118216176/aa8b0309-4981-475c-a5bd-47d4c00db478)

## License

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made
under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

---------

Signed-off-by: nkomonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* fix(codewihsperer): mapping language code before calling sendTelemetry API (#3928)

* fix(codewhisperer): no auto trigger in Cloud9 #3927

* feat(settings): check that user settings.json is valid #3924

Problem:
vscode notifies the user if `settings.json` is complete nonsense, but is
silent if there are only "recoverable" JSON syntax errors. So _reading_
settings will appear to work, but _writing_ settings will throw an
exception. #3910

Solution:
On startup, check that we can actually _write_ settings, and show an
error message if not.

* watchedfiles: add watch patterns once to avoid rebuilding n times (#3931)

Rrebuilding after each additional watch pattern meant we were
processing globs n times, with each run containing `{1, 2, 3, ... , n-1,
n}` patterns. Swapping this to an array and enforcing adding the
patterns once ensures we only process 1 time, for n globs on initial
load. We aren't adding globs dynamically at any point; if we ever feel
the need to, we can implement some fancy caching/expiry business.

FWIW it seems like getting the files in the glob is fairly fast, so if
processing files is the bottleneck, this might be the cure? I'm sure we
can improve more going forward regardless.

  dependency-group: github-actions
...

Co-authored-by: dependabot[bot] <49699333+dependabot[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

* fix(redshift): stale cache in connection wizard #3926

Problem:
1. When the connection parameters is removed, the re-launched connection wizard still has the earlier connection parameters.
2. When a sql query is successful but doesn't return any record, the output message is not clear.

Solution:
1. Remove the connection wizard from the redshiftWarehouseNode constructor. When a connection wizard is launched, a new instance is created.
2. Modify the output message when a sql query is successful but doesn't return any record.

* fix: Toolkit always opens Output panel on startup #3939

Problem:
Output panel always opens at VS Code launch. #3930

Solution:
Instead of showing Output panel at Redshift activation, change to show Output panel only when a message is added.

* auth: Helper methods to check if connection exists (#3747)

* auth: funcs to indicate if the connection exists

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* codewhisperer: method that indicates if valid connection exists

For the add connection telemetry we want to know if a CW auth'
connection already exists, not necessarily the currently active
one.

This adds 2 methods that return true if the valid CW connection
exists and is known by the toolkit.

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* refactor: create isSsoConnection() alternatives

A sso connection contains different types of sso connections,
such as Builder ID or AWS Identity Center (Base).

This commit creates functions to enable a user to check
with specificity of if a connection is of a specific type
of sso connection.

Additionally, it updates existing uses to the appropriate
implementation.

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* codecatalyst: function if toolkit is aware of valid builder id

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* refactor: fix circular dep issue

Moves isValidCodeCatalystConnection() to the
auth/connections.ts module and it fixes the circular dep

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* refactor: rename 'base' sso to 'idc' sso

This naming is easier to understand even though
the term Identity Center (idc) is purely a brand
name and subject to change in the future.

Signed-off-by: nkomonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>
Signed-off-by: nkomonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* feat(cloudwatchlogs): preserve position while loading items #3934

Problem:
When trying to select a CloudWatch Log Stream, the UI scrolls to the top
while fetching all streams, which is very difficult to use.

Solution:
Set `keepScrollPosition = true` by default.
Closes #2379

* codewhisperer: switch to default model when receiving ResouceNotFoundException (#3941)

* filewatcher: template watcher lazy-loads if enableCodeLenses is off (#3938)

## Problem
The template file watcher always ran regardless of SAM hint setting

## Solution
The template file watcher now loads on demand. This appears to work even when toggling from off to on (codelenses appear on the template file)
* ~~This may hit the startup function multiple times? Will do some more testing~~ should be resolved with https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/pull/3938/commits/0b1df9d39df91638e749d4825735f548e45ece28
* Confirmed SAM debug works, when coming from startup with codelenses disabled
* Confirmed the registry builds when codelenses are enabled

* deps: bump @types/vscode to 1.68 #3880

previous: 5439f9527224d8d1c0b98cd9941ee55a0cefb9ae

* refactor(watchedfiles): rename getRegisteredItem => getItem

Problem:
getRegisteredItem implies there is some other kind of "item", which is
confusing.

Solution:
Rename to getItem.

* refactor(watchedfiles): rename registeredItems => items

Problem:
The name `registeredItems` implies there is some other kind of "item",
which is confusing and noisy, and unnecessarily verbose.

Solution:
Rename to `items`.

* codewhisperer: reduce token infilling suggestions (#3944)

* refactor(redshift): logging and output messages #3943

Problem:
There are similar logging and output message in node explorer. Refactoring code to centralize logging and message output makes it easy for maintenance.

Solution:
Create message functions and add them in utils.

* feat(lambda): increase timeout to 5 minutes #3954

* fix(sam): "Invalid (or missing) template file"

Problem:
SAM debug may fail to find template.yaml even if it is explicitly given
by `invokeTarget.templatePath` in the vscode launch config. #2614

Solution:
- Always call addItem() in validate(), instead of depending on the
  workspace-wide "scan".
- Log a message when process() fails to process the file contents.

* fix(sam): "Add SAM Debug Configuration" does nothing

Problem:
"AWS: Add SAM Debug Configuration" only works the first time it is
invoked. regression from 89b8a941c497e3b4e58f9e85e37f3861dd0a7c1b

Solution:
Move samDebugConfigCmd() out of the if-condition.

* changelog #3957

* cloud9: skip "!isWeb" check #3956

Problem:
Cloud9 sets `isWeb` even though it has "compute".

Solution:
Add an explicit condition for Cloud9 wherever we check `isWeb`.

ref d2f03d52a221

* feat(codewhisperer): select customization by prefix (#3947)

Problem:
The `aws.codeWhisperer.connect` command was introduced to allow enterprises
to establish a default customization for onboarding developers after
establishing an IdC connection.

However, it only selected with a given ARN. Given the current behavior
for adding updated customization for CodeWhisperer, an enterprise would
need to keep the ARN up-to-date as well when calling this command.

Solution:
Provide the ability to define the customization to select with a
prefix for the customization name. This way the logic to select a
customization as updated customizations are introduced can be simplified
on the administrator side by maintaining a prefix.
e.g. MyModel-v1, MyModel-v2, etc.

Co-authored-by: Will Lovo <wlovo@amazon.com>

* perf(startup): avoid templateRegistry in awsFiletypes.ts #3962

Problem:
The AWS Documents handler (`awsFiletypes.ts`) is triggered frequently.
It calls `globals.templateRegistry` which triggers an expensive
"Scanning CloudFormation templates..." process. #3510

Solution:
Extract the validation logic out of `CloudFormationTemplateRegistry.process()`
so that `awsFiletypes.ts` can use it without requesting the full registry.

* Release 1.96.0

* Update version to snapshot version: 1.97.0-SNAPSHOT

* feat: sm ide #3837

Problem:
New SM VSCode IDE with IAM role, we want to use the IAM role for Code Whisperer
auth. Currently Code Whisperer auth used Builder ID/SSO/Cloud9(IAM). Current IAM
auth is for Cloud9 IDE and does not allow for paginated results.

Solution:
Add new IDE type for SM VSCode that can be used for this feature and future
modifications. Use the new IDE type for conditional on connection type to use,
defaulting to IAM. Use IAM for Code Whisperer and make sure we use the correct,
`generateRecommendations`, endpoint to allow for auth with IAM and paginated
results.

---------

Problem:
[microsoft/vscode#173861](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/173861)

Solution:
Inject http agent only for the GenerateCompletions API, do this per IDE session.

   GenerateCompletions API when user is NOT using `http.proxy` vscode feature.

4. Tested in AWS Cloud9.

* External fix(ecs): exec command requires SimulatePrincipalPolicy permissions #3993

Problem:
We attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` to verify the container task role
has proper permissions before running exec command. Users may not have
access to simulate policies, but may otherwise be able to run exec
command without issue. #3969

Solution:
Only attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` if exec command fails. Otherwise,
there is no need to simulate policies.

## Solution

number depending on what was changed (similar to how [diagnostics are
updated](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/blob/0974becd8d26bc12a640b34bfbefc2e20fe8cb17/src/codewhisperer/service/diagnosticsProvider.ts#L61-L93
))

* fix(codewihsperer): mapping language code before calling sendTelemetry API (#3928)

* fix(codewhisperer): no auto trigger in Cloud9 #3927

* feat(settings): check that user settings.json is valid #3924

Problem:
vscode notifies the user if `settings.json` is complete nonsense, but is
silent if there are only "recoverable" JSON syntax errors. So _reading_
settings will appear to work, but _writing_ settings will throw an
exception. #3910

Solution:
On startup, check that we can actually _write_ settings, and show an
error message if not.

* watchedfiles: add watch patterns once to avoid rebuilding n times (#3931)

Rrebuilding after each additional watch pattern meant we were
processing globs n times, with each run containing `{1, 2, 3, ... , n-1,
n}` patterns. Swapping this to an array and enforcing adding the
patterns once ensures we only process 1 time, for n globs on initial
load. We aren't adding globs dynamically at any point; if we ever feel
the need to, we can implement some fancy caching/expiry business.

FWIW it seems like getting the files in the glob is fairly fast, so if
processing files is the bottleneck, this might be the cure? I'm sure we
can improve more going forward regardless.

Problem:
"AWS: Add SAM Debug Configuration" only works the first time it is
invoked. regression from 89b8a941c497e3b4e58f9e85e37f3861dd0a7c1b

Solution:
Move samDebugConfigCmd() out of the if-condition.

* changelog #3957

* cloud9: skip "!isWeb" check #3956

Problem:
Cloud9 sets `isWeb` even though it has "compute".

Solution:
Add an explicit condition for Cloud9 wherever we check `isWeb`.

ref d2f03d52a221

* feat(codewhisperer): select customization by prefix (#3947)

Problem:
The `aws.codeWhisperer.connect` command was introduced to allow enterprises
to establish a default customization for onboarding developers after
establishing an IdC connection.

However, it only selected with a given ARN. Given the current behavior
for adding updated customization for CodeWhisperer, an enterprise would
need to keep the ARN up-to-date as well when calling this command.

Solution:
Provide the ability to define the customization to select with a
prefix for the customization name. This way the logic to select a
customization as updated customizations are introduced can be simplified
on the administrator side by maintaining a prefix.
e.g. MyModel-v1, MyModel-v2, etc.

Co-authored-by: Will Lovo <wlovo@amazon.com>

* perf(startup): avoid templateRegistry in awsFiletypes.ts #3962

Problem:
The AWS Documents handler (`awsFiletypes.ts`) is triggered frequently.
It calls `globals.templateRegistry` which triggers an expensive
"Scanning CloudFormation templates..." process. #3510

Solution:
Extract the validation logic out of `CloudFormationTemplateRegistry.process()`
so that `awsFiletypes.ts` can use it without requesting the full registry.

* Release 1.96.0

* Update version to snapshot version: 1.97.0-SNAPSHOT

* feat: sm ide #3837

Problem:
New SM VSCode IDE with IAM role, we want to use the IAM role for Code Whisperer
auth. Currently Code Whisperer auth used Builder ID/SSO/Cloud9(IAM). Current IAM
auth is for Cloud9 IDE and does not allow for paginated results.

Solution:
Add new IDE type for SM VSCode that can be used for this feature and future
modifications. Use the new IDE type for conditional on connection type to use,
defaulting to IAM. Use IAM for Code Whisperer and make sure we use the correct,
`generateRecommendations`, endpoint to allow for auth with IAM and paginated
results.

---------

perf(codewhisperer): connection reuse for generationCompletions #4040

Problem:
[microsoft/vscode#173861](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/173861)

Solution:
Inject http agent only for the GenerateCompletions API, do this per IDE session.

Tested and verified:
1. This inject won't happen for any other API calls. It only applies to
   GenerateCompletions API when user is NOT using `http.proxy` vscode feature.
2. No regression found with Toolkit features or CodeWhisperer features.
3. Regardless of user VSC proxy setting `http.proxySupport`, it still enables HTTP connection reuse.
4. Tested in AWS Cloud9.

* External fix(ecs): exec command requires SimulatePrincipalPolicy permissions #3993

Problem:
We attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` to verify the container task role
has proper permissions before running exec command. Users may not have
access to simulate policies, but may otherwise be able to run exec
command without issue. #3969

Solution:
Only attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` if exec command fails. Otherwise,
there is no need to simulate policies.

## Problem

Hovers positions are not being updated if the document changes.

## Solution

Add an event handler which either removes the hover or offsets the line
number depending on what was changed (similar to how [diagnostics are
updated](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/blob/0974becd8d26bc12a640b34bfbefc2e20fe8cb17/src/codewhisperer/service/diagnosticsProvider.ts#L61-L93
))

under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

Signed-off-by: nkomonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* fix(codewihsperer): mapping language code before calling sendTelemetry API (#3928)

* fix(codewhisperer): no auto trigger in Cloud9 #3927

* feat(settings): check that user settings.json is valid #3924

Problem:
vscode notifies the user if `settings.json` is complete nonsense, but is
silent if there are only "recoverable" JSON syntax errors. So _reading_
settings will appear to work, but _writing_ settings will throw an
exception. #3910

Solution:
On startup, check that we can actually _write_ settings, and show an
error message if not.

* watchedfiles: add watch patterns once to avoid rebuilding n times (#3931)

Rrebuilding after each additional watch pattern meant we were
processing globs n times, with each run containing `{1, 2, 3, ... , n-1,
n}` patterns. Swapping this to an array and enforcing adding the
patterns once ensures we only process 1 time, for n globs on initial
load. We aren't adding globs dynamically at any point; if we ever feel
the need to, we can implement some fancy caching/expiry business.

FWIW it seems like getting the files in the glob is fairly fast, so if
processing files is the bottleneck, this might be the cure? I'm sure we
can improve more going forward regardless.

* fix(redshift): stale cache in connection wizard #3926

Problem:
1. When the connection parameters is removed, the re-launched connection wizard still has the earlier connection parameters.
2. When a sql query is successful but doesn't return any record, the output message is not clear.

Solution:
1. Remove the connection wizard from the redshiftWarehouseNode constructor. When a connection wizard is launched, a new instance is created.
2. Modify the output message when a sql query is successful but doesn't return any record.

* fix: Toolkit always opens Output panel on startup #3939

Problem:
Output panel always opens at VS Code launch. #3930

Solution:
Instead of showing Output panel at Redshift activation, change to show Output panel only when a message is added.

For the add connection telemetry we want to know if a CW auth'
connection already exists, not necessarily the currently active
one.

This adds 2 methods that return true if the valid CW connection
exists and is known by the toolkit.

Signed-off-by: Nikolas Komonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* refactor: create isSsoConnection() alternatives

A sso connection contains different types of sso connections,
such as Builder ID or AWS Identity Center (Base).

This commit creates functions to enable a user to check
with specificity of if a connection is of a specific type
of sso connection.

Additionally, it updates existing uses to the appropriate
implementation.

name and subject to change in the future.

* Merging staging to feature/codewhisperer/asssited-coderemediation branch (#1305)

perf(codewhisperer): connection reuse for generationCompletions #4040

Problem:
[microsoft/vscode#173861](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/173861)

Solution:
Inject http agent only for the GenerateCompletions API, do this per IDE session.

Tested and verified:
1. This inject won't happen for any other API calls. It only applies to
   GenerateCompletions API when user is NOT using `http.proxy` vscode feature.
2. No regression found with Toolkit features or CodeWhisperer features.
3. Regardless of user VSC proxy setting `http.proxySupport`, it still enables HTTP connection reuse.
4. Tested in AWS Cloud9.

[DEVOPS-1135] update Terragrunt package up to 0.54.1 and fix the API references (#1) (#297)

https://physitrack.atlassian.net/browse/DEVOPS-1135

## Description

As we were discussing in the Slack channel - the outdated Terragrunt
package in the terragrunt-atlantis-config binary is preventing us from
using the `disable` attribute in the `generate` blocks introduced to
Terragrunt in v0.45.16. It's a deal-breaker for us as we're using this
feature to prevent AWS Provider generation (which is generated by
default).

This PR updates the Terragrunt packages and patches the changes in the
API. Given a chance I've also tried to run this against Go 1.21, seems
like there's no issue with that.

I'm not setting up the CI for this project, so here are tests run from
my localhost:

commit.message:
Gradient CEM-Related Work (#29)

* Feature streamlined seeding (#28)

* Minor updates

* Add consistent use of rng's in:
- all controllers
- CartPole environment

* Consistent rng instantiation in all controllers

* #23 Minor fixes

* #23: Add info origin to log message

* Replace Python `exec` statements where possible #22

* #22: Single-line, 2 imports from string

* - Translate rng changes to new controllers
- Remove some unused imports

* Apply #22 to the new controllers

* Add explanation on seed to config

* - Some additional gitignores
- More req's added
- Readme update
- Updated gym loop

* Environment-agnostic predictor import

* Complete previous commit

* Remove now-unused imports:
-> Removes dependencies on cartpole predictors

* Pass all controller attributes in constructor #31s
- Done for all controllers intended to be portable to other environments
- Save rollout trajectories and their costs in attributes .Q, .J

* Encapsulation of controllers:
- Keep an environment mock
- Call costs on an instance of the selected kind
- Remove target_position (CartPole-specific) from .step(...)

* Some polishing

* Use relative imports in all externally usable controllers

* Update ref to its own subrepo

* - Update gym imlementation
- Remove relative imports

* Move controller template to module init

* Go back to correct shifting for next iteration

* Reference to SI_Toolkit_ASF (not global)

* Update ref

* Update ref

* - Rename global ASF to be installable as SI_Toolkit_ASF

* Add GLOBALLY_DISABLE_COMPILATION flag to package

* Update ref

* - Allow import from config even if called from parent git module
- CartPole Gym Env improvements

* Update ref

* - Controllers clip output to action space dimension
- Add mock action space to CartPole instance
    - Controllers now get action clipping limits from environment, instead of assuming them
- Add optimization termination criterion to adamresamp2 controller

* Minor beautification

* Prepare for rendering of new step API

* Save stored variabled more explicitly

* Log rollout trajectories in some controllers

* - Some smaller updates to existing controllers
- Add Bharadhwaj controller (different to cem naive grad)

* Move general controllers to Control_Toolkit

* Add 2 more tests

* Check all controllers

* Update ref

* Copy config files to ASF folder

* Update ref

* Move a utils function to control toolkit

* Get controller

* Add missing import

* Consistent use of dt

* No seed as NoneType instead of "None" string

* Use predictor names instead of types everywhere

* - Run MPPI TF on physical
- Add target equilibrium variable
- Use the right config in controller_mppi

* Remove path prefix from get_available_controller_names

* Update config

* Rename to predictor_name

* - Delete unused ASF Global package
- Move cost weights to cartpole config

* Update refs

* Move SI_Toolkit ASF to folder instead of using installed package

* - Update set_controller
- Target position now tf Variable if env is tf
- Make sure all controllers work

* - Replace config loading by try/except everywhere
    - Introduce precedence without fallback

* Some renaming of outdated stuff

Merge acr into awsq (#1319)

* CodeWhisperer: TS, C#, Cloud Formation[JSON & YAML/YML] & Terraform [TF & HCL] language support for Security Scans (#1182)

* CW: Add TS language for CG Security scans

* Add Csharp langauge for SecurityScans along with Test Cases

* CW: Revised Code for C# language

* CW: Adding CloudFormation support for security scans

* CW:YAML and JSON implementation in VSC

* CW:Test cases for Cloud Formation

* CW:Test cases for CF

* CW: Support for Terraform TF&HCL

* CW: Add test cases for Terraform TF & HCL

* CW: Revised Changes

* Merge branch 'feature/iaacsecurityscans' staging into feature/iaacsecurityscans

* CW: Revised changes for CSharp

* CW: Changes in TS Implementation

* CW: Change in HCL Implementation

* CW: Revised changes Terraform

* CW: Add TS language for CG Security scans

* Add Csharp langauge for SecurityScans along with Test Cases

* CW: Revised Code for C# language

* CW: Adding CloudFormation support for security scans

* CW:YAML and JSON implementation in VSC

* CW:Test cases for Cloud Formation

* CW:Test cases for CF

* CW: Support for Terraform TF&HCL

* CW: Add test cases for Terraform TF & HCL

* CW: Revised Changes

* Merge branch 'feature/iaacsecurityscans' staging into feature/iaacsecurityscans

* CW: Revised changes for CSharp

* CW: Changes in TS Implementation

* CW: Change in HCL Implementation

* CW: Revised changes Terraform

* External fix(ecs): exec command requires SimulatePrincipalPolicy permissions #3993

Problem:
We attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` to verify the container task role
has proper permissions before running exec command. Users may not have
access to simulate policies, but may otherwise be able to run exec
command without issue. #3969

Solution:
Only attempt `SimulatePrincipalPolicy` if exec command fails. Otherwise,
there is no need to simulate policies.

* CW: Revised changes

* CW:Revised Code

* CW:Revised Changes according to PR Comments

* CW:Revised Changes

* CW: Various Changes

* CW: various changes according to PR

* CW: Adding a Test Case for CSharp Security Scans

---------

Co-authored-by: Laxman Reddy <141967714+LaxmanReddyAileni@users.noreply.github.com>

* Merge from public (#1275)

* CodeWhisperer: Security Issue Hover Provider (#3884)

* add hover provider for security issues

* add unit tests

* codewhisperer: add markdown content for hover (#3890)

* add markdown content for hover

* allow multiple add/deletions in the same diff

* codewhisperer: security hover update range and format (#3908)

## Problem

Hovers positions are not being updated if the document changes.

## Solution

Add an event handler which either removes the hover or offsets the line
number depending on what was changed (similar to how [diagnostics are
updated](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/blob/0974becd8d26bc12a640b34bfbefc2e20fe8cb17/src/codewhisperer/service/diagnosticsProvider.ts#L61-L93
)) 
## License

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made
under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

* codewhisperer: add quick fix code actions for issues (#3932)

* codewhisperer: create webview panel for security issue (#3896)

* create webview panel for security issue

* update webview html

* refactor to use vue webview factory

* clean up

* update webview styles

* hide apply fix button when no suggested fix available

* update model

* fix tests

* codewhisperer: telemetry metrics for hover #3955

Problem
We want to track metrics for the number of times a user hovered on a vulnerability line.

Solution
Added metric event codewhisperer_codeScanIssueHover that will emit every time an issue is hovered over.

* Merge master into feature/codewhisperer/assisted-code-remediation (#3929)

* auth: ellipsis + right click options for `Developer Tools` (#3925)

This commit allows user to right click to root CW or CC
Node or click the new ellipsis icon, and they will get
the options to Add Connection or Signout (if appropriate)

![Screenshot 2023-10-20 at 10 50 42
AM](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/assets/118216176/c934c3b6-4b8b-40b8-a24e-2c8a7a1988c6)

![Kapture 2023-10-20 at 10 36
27](https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/assets/118216176/aa8b0309-4981-475c-a5bd-47d4c00db478)

## License

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made
under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

---------

Signed-off-by: nkomonen <nkomonen@amazon.com>

* fix(codewihsperer): mapping language code before calling sendTelemetry API (#3928)

* fix(codewhisperer): no auto trigger in Cloud9 #3927

* feat(settings): check that user settings.json is valid #3924

Problem:
vscode notifies the user if `settings.json` is complete nonsense, but is
silent if there are only "recoverable" JSON syntax errors. So _reading_
settings will appear to work, but _writing_ settings will throw an
exception. #3910

Solution:
On startup, check that we can actually _write_ settings, and show an
error message if not.

* watchedfiles: add watch patterns once to avoid rebuilding n times (#3931)

Rrebuilding after each additional watch pattern meant we were
processing globs n times, with each run containing `{1, 2, 3, ... , n-1,
n}` patterns. Swapping this to an array and enforcing adding the
patterns once ensures we only process 1 time, for n globs on initial
load. We aren't adding globs dynamically at any point; if we ever feel
the need to, we can implement some fancy caching/expiry business.

FWIW it seems like getting the files in the glob is fairly fast, so if
processing files is the bottleneck, this might be the cure? I'm sure we
can improve more going forward regardless.
